resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

 // specific language governing permissions and limitations
 // under the License.
 
-///! Array types
+//! Defines public types representing Apache Arrow arrays. Arrow's specification defines an array as
+//! "a sequence of values with known length all having the same type." For example, the type
+//! `Int16Array` represents an Apache Arrow array of 16-byte integers.
 
 Review comment:
   `16-byte` -> `16-bit`.

paulkernfeld commented on issue #3448:  ARROW-4245: [Rust] Add Rustdoc header to source files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3448#issuecomment-457013411
 
 
   Oops! My test was calling a function that contains some unsafe behavior, so the results of the test were nondeterministic. I have now fixed the test. I think that [ARROW-3776](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3776), "Mark methods that do not perform bounds checking as unsafe," could be helpful to others in avoiding a similar pitfall.
   
   I think this PR is ready for another review now.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3448#discussion_r250614627
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/array.rs
 ##########
 @@ -15,7 +15,37 @@
 // specific language governing permissions and limitations
 // under the License.
 
-///! Array types
+//! Defines public types representing Apache Arrow arrays. Arrow's specification defines an array as
+//! "a sequence of values with known length all having the same type." For example, the type
+//! `Int16Array` represents an Apache Arrow array of 16-bit integers.
+//!
+//! ```
+//! extern crate arrow;
+//!
+//! use arrow::array::Int16Array;
+//!
+//! // Create a new builder with a capacity of 100
 
 Review comment:
   I think this should read "with a capacity for at least 100 array slots".  The actual capacity is rounded up I believe, see [here](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/rust/arrow/src/buffer.rs#L154)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Each source file should contain a rustdoc header giving a summary of the contents of the file. This will make the documentation hosted on docs.rs much more useful.
fields.summary: [Rust] Add Rustdoc header to each source file

comments.body: I'm interested in trying to do this. Could someone take a look at [these example docs I wrote|https://github.com/apache/arrow/compare/master...paulkernfeld:arrow-4245-add-rustdoc-headers] to see if I'm going in the right direction?  If they look good, I'm happy to add more. I deliberately added a lot of examples in the docs because I find that I'm personally a lot more likely to engage with a project if it has lots of examples.

[~paulkernfeld] To get better feedback, I recommend to already open a PR on GitHub and prefixing it with {{WIP}} (work in progress). This gives us the better review tools while everyone is aware that the work is not done yet.

[~paulkernfeld] This is exactly what I had in mind :) 

I look forward to seeing the PR
Okay, thanks for the advice! I have just created a PR, so please let me know how it looks.
